definition: finding little support/neglected
few/scant/widowed
to help/to assist
an unjust cause finds little support (idiom, from Mencius)/cf 得道多助[de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4] a just cause attracts much support
A just cause attracts much support, an unjust one finds little (idiom, from Mencius)
pinyin: de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4 , shi1 dao4 gua3 zhu4

definition: receiving much help (from outside)/well supported
A just cause attracts much support, an unjust one finds little (idiom, from Mencius)

definition: an unjust cause finds little support (idiom, from Mencius)/cf 得道多助[de2 dao4 duo1 zhu4] a just cause attracts much support
to lose the way/unjust/moral failing
a just cause enjoys abundant support (idiom); those upholding justice will find help all around
the rich man cannot be benevolent (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
to know the enemy and know oneself (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War")
the unvarnished truth is better than a cunning ruse (idiom)/honesty is the best policy

definition: What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.

that which is yearned for by the public
